semantic_title: Anemia Associated with Malignancy Coding and Sequencing
section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 2. Chapter 2: Neoplasms > c. Coding and sequencing of complications > 1) Anemia associated with malignancy

content.full_text: When admission/encounter is for management of an anemia associated with the malignancy, and the treatment is only for anemia, the appropriate code for the malignancy is sequenced as the principal or first-listed diagnosis followed by the appropriate code for the anemia (such as code D63.0, Anemia in neoplastic disease). (Evidence: pg no: 34, L29-L31)
content.summary: Sequencing guidelines for anemia caused by malignancy where treatment is only for anemia (Evidence: pg no: 34, L29-L31)
key_concepts: Anemia associated with malignancy (Evidence: pg no: 34, L29-L30)
Treatment only for anemia (Evidence: pg no: 34, L30)
Malignancy sequenced first (Evidence: pg no: 34, L30-L31)
Anemia code follows malignancy code (Evidence: pg no: 34, L30-L31)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Malignancy code is sequenced as principal/first-listed diagnosis followed by anemia code (Evidence: pg no: 34, L30-L31)
detailed_rules.explanation: When treating anemia caused by malignancy, the underlying malignancy takes precedence in sequencing even though treatment is directed at the anemia (Evidence: pg no: 34, L29-L31)
common_applications: Patient with lung cancer develops anemia, admitted for blood transfusion

workflow_steps: Step 1: Confirm anemia is associated with malignancy

Step 3: Sequence malignancy code as principal/first-listed
